headline: Social Impact | Philanthropy | Employee Engagement
summary: Experienced philanthropy and employee engagement professional with track record of building strategic and mutually-beneficial impact partnerships and programs. An authentic storyteller who activates employees and organizations to do good by combining passion and strategy. A creative thinker who always looks for a win-win outcome that benefits people, profits and the planet, with a committed pursuit of equality and social justice.

experiences.company: CSAA Insurance Group, a AAA Insurer
experiences.title: Manager, Community Impact

experiences.company: CSAA Insurance Group, a AAA Insurer
experiences.title: Community Relations Program Lead

experiences.company: CSAA Insurance Group, a AAA Insurer
experiences.title: Community Relations Program Manager
Corporate Development Officer
experiences.description:
•	Developed and executed ongoing strategy for prospecting, cultivating, soliciting and stewarding philanthropic revenue from a diverse portfolio of regional, national and global corporations.

•	Managed partnerships with 50 corporate accounts including AAA Northern California, Nevada and Utah, Airbnb, CSAA Insurance Group, Kaiser Permanente, McKesson Corporation, Salesforce.com, Twitter, Wells Fargo and Workday. 

•	Assisted corporations achieve brand & marketing, employee engagement and community investment goals by aligning mutual needs and interests. Created custom philanthropic opportunities and ensured effective strategies were utilized to increase income opportunities for the Red Cross, resulting in nearly $2.5 million in revenue.

experiences.title: Corporate Development Associate
experiences.description:
•	Promoted mid-fiscal year to manage over 40 employee giving, event sponsorship, episodic disaster and other corporate accounts to raise more than $900K in fiscal year 2014.

•	Created suite of training materials and delivered presentations for team of over 20 colleagues (Biomedical Fundraising) and 40 Board Members (Leveraging Relationships to Increase Corporate Funding) to increase fundraising capacity and strategy. The training for colleagues led to the first six-figure gift made in support of Biomedical Services and the training for Board Members led to the establishment of board-led corporate campaigns for Santa Cruz and Monterey Bay markets. 

•	Implemented long-term strategic planning for regional corporate fundraising through the creation of partnership concept papers, managing project timelines and leading special initiatives for Chief Development Officer, CEO and national fundraisers to advance corporate relationships in our Region.

experiences.title: Corporate Development Specialist
experiences.description:
•	Managed project deliverables for region’s largest corporate accounts, providing grant writing, annual reporting, stewardship and benefits delivery in support of six and seven-figure partnerships. 

•	Led the strategic development and execution of regional employee engagement activities, increasing the variety and scope of partner participation from one group training to multiple opportunities for engagement across six lines of service. 

•	Served as team lead for Salesforce database during conversion from Raiser’s Edge, supporting team of seven gift officers and five executives to ensure accuracy and cleanliness of data.

experiences.title: Fundraising Events Coordinator (Contractor)
experiences.description:
•	Planned and executed logistics for three cultivation and partner-sponsored events, ranging from 15 to 300 guests through: communication with vendors, sponsors and attendees, creation of marketing & social media content, on-site production, and post-event collateral creation, financial consolidation and analysis

•	Focused on managing in-house production of the third Annual "Give Work Gala," which raised over $250,000 to support the social enterprise's mission of providing digital employment to women and youth in the developing world. 

•	Led donor research and outreach activities to support team’s financial planning process to identify prospective individual, corporate and foundation opportunities for a forecast sales funnel of $6M.

education.field_of_study: World Arts and Cultures, Global Studies
education.description:
Graduated Cum Laude

Completed a senior honor project in World Arts and Cultures - an 18-month personal and artistic exploration culminated in an eight-minute dance theater work about family, identity and feeling different titled "Family Photo". 

Completed a senior thesis in Global Studies - "Globalization and Urbanisation- Is There A Sustainable Model?", advised by Dr. Russell A. Burgos
education.activities_and_societies: Pediatric AIDS Coalition, World Arts and Cultures Undergraduate Society, School of the Arts and Architecture Dean's Council, Cultural Affairs Commission, Financial Supports Commission, Swipes for the Homeless Executive Board
